page.title: 01LANDSCAPE BOREHAM NORTH
page.content: The area lies to the North West of Boreham Village, and includes part of the hamlet of Russell Green and a small part of Little Waltham. Much of the land is devoted to farming, but in the South East there is some housing, and this is separated from the farmland by the A.12. trunk road, which together with the railway, which runs parallel with the road, forms one of the main communication links in Essex. The A.12. contrasts with the remainder of the roads, which are narrow, and sometimes twisting. There are two noteworthy houses New Hall, and Mount Maskall, several farms, a golf course, some gravel pits,part of a small industrial complex and a disused airfield, now used by Fords to test cars.
